titleStmt.title: Judgement and mercy: or, The plague of frogges [brace] inflicted, removed. Delivered in nine sermons, by the late reverend and learned divine Mr. Iosias Shute, Arch-deacon of Colchester, and preacher at St. Mary Woolnoth, in London: with his usuall prayers before and after sermon. Whereunto is added a sermon preached at his funerall, by Mr. Ephraim Vdall. Imprimatur. Ja. Cranford. Octob. 29. 1644.
titleStmt.author: Shute, Josias, 1588-1643.
Udall, Ephraim, d. 1647. Sermon preached at the funerall of Mr. Shute.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Charles Greene, and are to be sold at his shop in Ivie Lane at the signe of the Gun.,

notesStmt.note: Ephraim Udall's "A sermon preached at the funerall of Mr. Shute" has caption title, separate pagination and register, and is identified as Thomason E.299[2].
Page numbers 177-178 are omitted in page numbering.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Ivie Lane at the signe of the Gun.
